words.etymology_text: From Proto-Finnic *kabeh, borrowed from Proto-Germanic *skapiz (compare Proto-Germanic *skapą, Old English gesceap). Cognate with Estonian kabu, Karelian kaveh, Võro kabo and Proto-Samic *kuopës (“witch”).

words.etymology_text: From Proto-Finnic *kapja + -o (compare dialectal kapia). Ultimately borrowing from Germanic. Cognate to Estonian kabi, Votic kabjõ.
kaveri + -ata; the long -e- is by analogy with other -eerata verbs (such as halveerata, maskeerata, siteerata).
